intro: Jambosa kigurrung, commonly known as the mountain jambosa, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stem and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are typically harvested when fully mature, and its leaves are often used in traditional medicine. Due to its habitat in mountainous areas, it is relatively rare and requires specific environmental conditions to thrive.
